iris_classification.name: Iris Flower Classification (Demo)
iris_classification.description: Classic machine learning dataset with 150 iris flowers. Perfect for validating that clustering algorithms work correctly and identifying the 3 species (Setosa, Versicolor, Virginica).
iris_classification.best_for: First-time users, algorithm validation, educational purposes

questions.question: What is the purpose of this clustering demo?
questions.default: Validate clustering algorithms by identifying 3 flower species

questions.question: Do you know the expected number of clusters?
How many clusters do you expect?

iris_classification.success_criteria: Should identify 3 distinct clusters corresponding to the 3 species

interpretation_guide.expected_result: Setosa should be very distinct; Versicolor and Virginica may have some overlap
interpretation_guide.business_value: Demonstrates algorithm's ability to discover natural groupings in data

customer_segmentation.name: Customer Segmentation (Demo)
customer_segmentation.description: Mall customer demographics and spending behavior. Identifies customer segments for targeted marketing campaigns based on age, income, and spending patterns.
customer_segmentation.best_for: Business stakeholders, marketing teams, demonstrating ROI

questions.question: What is the business goal of customer segmentation?
questions.default: Identify customer groups for targeted marketing campaigns

questions.question: Do you know how many customer segments exist?
How many customer segments do you expect?
questions.hint: Typical segments: budget shoppers, high spenders, savers, etc.

questions.question: What factors are most important for segmentation?

interpretation_guide.what_to_look_for: Clear separation between high/low spenders and income levels

expected_segments.1: Young Budget Shoppers - Low income, moderate spending
expected_segments.2: Young High Spenders - High income, high spending (target for premium products)
expected_segments.3: Middle Age Moderate - Average across all metrics
expected_segments.4: High Income Savers - High income but low spending (needs incentives)
expected_segments.5: Senior Varied - Diverse group requiring personalized approach

interpretation_guide.business_value: Enables targeted marketing: premium products for segment 2, discounts/incentives for segment 4
actionable_insights: Create VIP programs for high spenders
Offer budget-friendly options for young shoppers

network_intrusion.name: Network Intrusion Detection (Demo)
network_intrusion.description: Cybersecurity use case identifying network attack patterns. Demonstrates anomaly detection by clustering normal traffic separately from various attack types (DoS, Probe, R2L, U2R).
network_intrusion.best_for: IT operations, security analysts, technical demonstrations

questions.question: What is the security goal of this clustering analysis?
questions.default: Identify anomalous network traffic patterns and group attacks by type

questions.question: Do you know what types of attacks to look for?
What is your tolerance for false positives?
What clustering approach makes sense?

network_intrusion.success_criteria: Should identify 2-5 clusters: normal traffic and different attack categories

interpretation_guide.what_to_look_for: One large cluster (normal) and several smaller clusters (attacks)

expected_clusters.normal: Regular network traffic - largest cluster, low error rates, successful connections
expected_clusters.DoS: Denial of Service - high connection counts, high error rates, short durations
expected_clusters.Probe: Port Scanning - many connections to different services, high rejection rates
expected_clusters.R2L: Remote to Local - failed logins, guest access, unauthorized access attempts
expected_clusters.U2R: User to Root - root shell access, file creations, privilege escalation indicators

interpretation_guide.business_value: Early detection of security threats, automated alert triage, pattern recognition for new attack types
actionable_insights: Set up automated alerts for traffic matching attack cluster patterns
Investigate anomalous connections that don't fit normal cluster
Use cluster characteristics to tune IDS/IPS rules
Prioritize security response based on attack type clusters
interpretation_guide.technical_notes: Normal traffic should be largest cluster (~70% of data). Attack clusters typically smaller but have distinct patterns in error rates, connection counts, and service types.

nyc_taxi_analysis.name: NYC Taxi Spatial Clustering (Demo)
nyc_taxi_analysis.description: Geographical clustering of NYC taxi pickup/dropoff locations. Identifies popular areas, trip patterns, and optimal dispatch zones. Great for demonstrating spatial clustering and business intelligence.
nyc_taxi_analysis.best_for: Business intelligence, operations optimization, geographical analysis

questions.question: What is the business goal of this spatial analysis?
questions.default: Identify high-demand zones and optimize taxi dispatch locations

questions.question: What should we cluster on?
Do you know how many hotspot zones exist?
How many zones do you expect?

nyc_taxi_analysis.success_criteria: Should identify 5-10 geographical clusters corresponding to Manhattan neighborhoods/hotspots

interpretation_guide.what_to_look_for: Geographical clusters that align with known NYC neighborhoods and business districts

expected_clusters.Times Square: High pickup density, mixed trip distances, tourist area
expected_clusters.Transport Hubs: Airports, train stations (if included in sample)

interpretation_guide.business_value: Optimize taxi placement, dynamic pricing zones, driver allocation, predict demand patterns
actionable_insights: Deploy more taxis to high-demand clusters during peak hours
Set up surge pricing zones based on cluster characteristics
Optimize driver routes between popular pickup/dropoff cluster pairs
Predict earnings potential for drivers based on zone clusters
interpretation_guide.technical_notes: For spatial clustering, may want to use only lat/lon features. Including fare/duration can identify 'trip type' clusters instead of geographical zones. DBSCAN works well for geographical data as it handles arbitrary shapes.
interpretation_guide.visualization_tips: Plot clusters on a map overlay, use different colors for each cluster, cluster centers show optimal dispatch locations
